quote: Every single person is sacred. Sacred means special, precious, a treasure of true beauty. That means you.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Self-Reliance

quote: Explore the depth of the sacred world.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Dwell on your own sacred thoughts.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Woman is sacred; the woman one loves is holy.
author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

quote: Poetry and art and knowledge are sacred and pure.
author: George Eliot,  The Mill on the Floss

quote: Love's greatest gift is its ability to make everything it touches sacred.
author: Barbara de Angelis

quote: Seek to know thy sacred soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself over and over again.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Passion is a deep love for sacred activity.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: You are a great sacred soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Writing about the unholy is one way of writing about what is sacred.
author: Clive Barker

quote: Love's a Sacred Vessel [10w] Love's the sacred vessel embracing the mystical energy of evolution.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Every painting is a voyage into a sacred harbour.
author: Giotto di Bondone

quote: Each moment, each person, is sacred and worthy of respect- especially you.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree,  The Spiritual Girl's Guide to Dating: Your Enlightened Path to Love, Sex, & Soul Mates

quote: For every thing that lives is Holy.
author: William Blake,  The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

quote: I accept the Organic Trinity of Mineral, Vegetable, and Animal with as much authority as I accept the Holy Trinity. Both are sacred.
author: Terry Tempest Williams,  Leap

quote: Friendship, of itself a holy tie, is made more sacred by adversity.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Love is holy.
author: William Shakespeare,  All's Well That Ends Well

quote: There lies within thy soul sunshine, let it radiate the sacred light.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Even bad books are books and therefore sacred.
author: Günter Grass,  The Tin Drum

quote: The Sacred and The Scared. Which of these two categories does your love fall under? I should write a love poem on a rolled-up scroll so you’d know which one categorizes mine.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: The soul who does not live to give the best, deny the sacred self of full strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: I don't think writers are sacred, but words are. They deserve respect. If you get the right ones in the right order, you might nudge the world a little or make a poem that children will speak for you when you are dead.
author: Tom Stoppard,  The Real Thing: A Play

quote: To theology, ... only what it holds sacred is true, whereas to philosophy, only what holds true is sacred.
author: Ludwig Feuerbach,  Lectures on the Essence of Religion

quote: Every sacred travel transforms the soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Not matter what your sacred or religious book is, it's not how well you know the book, it's how well you're in alignment with the author.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light and sings when the dawn is still dark.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: The Simple PathSilence is PrayerPrayer is FaithFaith is LoveLove is ServiceThe Fruit of Service is Peace
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Faith is not the clinging to a shrine but an endless pilgrimage of the heart.
author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

quote: Religion is more than rite and ritual.
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: A faith to live by, a self to live with, and a purpose to live for.
author: Bob Harrington

quote: Love and respect all people. Hate and destroy all faith.
author: Penn Jillette,  God, No!: Signs You May Already Be an Atheist and Other Magical Tales

quote: Let my worship be within the heart that rejoices, for behold, all acts of love and pleasure are my rituals.Therefore, let there be beauty and strength, power and compassion, honor and humility, mirth and reverence within you.
author: Doreen Valiente,  Charge of the Goddess: The Mother of Modern Witchcraft

quote: In every ancient religious and sacred text, faith is a verb; a thing to be demonstrated. It is in modern days that we have diluted faith from an act to a philosophy.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Have faith in your beliefs
author: Michael Christos Zeis

quote: Without art, we should have no notion of the sacred; without science, we should always worship false gods.
author: W.H. Auden,  Selected Essays

quote: Love spiritually, not strategically.
author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"

quote: This is my living faith, an active faith, a faith of verbs: to question, explore, experiment, experience, walk, run, dance, play, eat, love, learn, dare, taste, touch, smell, listen, speak, write, read, draw, provoke, emote, scream, sin, repent, cry, kneel, pray, bow, rise, stand, look, laugh, cajole, create, confront, confound, walk back, walk forward, circle, hide, and seek.
author: Terry Tempest Williams,  Leap

quote: It's our faith that activates the power of God.
author: Joel Osteen,  Your Best Life Now: 7 Steps to Living at Your Full Potential

quote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Faith: a device of the mind, fed by the soul, that functions like crutches to a man in a wheelchair.
author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.

quote: Once you've condoned faith in general, you've condoned any crazy shit done because of faith.
author: Penn Jillette,  God, No!: Signs You May Already Be an Atheist and Other Magical Tales

quote: Its as if you think you'd never findReason and the Sacred intertwined
author: Molière,  Tartuffe

quote: Believe, my child. Faith is the food of survival.
author: Tobsha Learner,  The Witch of Cologne

quote: Christians. They’re determined to rid the land of any who worship the Horned One. Murdering all the druids, burning the temples, sometimes whole villages, and knocking over the standing stones.” The Lady’s face hardened. “This god of peace and love certainly likes to bathe the land in blood.
author: Brom,  The Child Thief

quote: Pactum serva"- "Keep the faith
author: Horace

quote: Faith is secured by adversity, but endangered by security.
author: Margaret Jensen

quote: If you are searching for sacred knowledge and not just a palliative for your fears, then you will train yourself to be a good skeptic.
author: Ann Druyan
